alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Valley; Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 3:56PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Douglas, southeastern Okanogan and northeastern Grant Counties through 430 PM PDT... At 356 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Nespelem Community, or 32 miles southeast of Omak, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nilles Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Okanogan Valley; Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau
